case_title: HAJI KHAN AND 2 OTHERS vs KHAMISO KHAN AND ANOTHERs
complaint_summary: The appellants contested the sale of land executed by Sanjar Khan Hajano, claiming he lacked a valid power-of-attorney and that the sale deed was forged.
investigation_summary: The respondents approached the Settlement Mukatiarkar for mutation of the disputed land, which was initially denied. Subsequent appeals to higher revenue authorities led to conflicting decisions, ultimately resulting in rejection of the petitioners' appeal by the Addl. Commissioner, Hyderabad.
judgment_summary: The court rejected the revision petition, ruling that the alienation did not contravene Para. 25 of repealed M.L.R. 64 of 1959 as the joint holding remained above subsistence level. Claims of forgery and non-payment were deemed matters for civil court.
legal_arguments: Contravention of Para. 25 of repealed M.L.R. 64 of 1959
Reduction of joint holding below subsistence level
summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around a disputed land sale executed by an alleged unauthorized attorney. The court ruled against the appellants, citing compliance with subsistence holding requirements and deferred fraud claims to civil court jurisdiction.
